page.title: 03VILLAGE SHOP FAIRWARP
page.content: We went in the mini-bus to Fairwarp to see a shop. When we arrived there we saw it had a Post-Office, drinks, puddings, pens, pencils, paper, ice-cream, lollies, dogfood and catfood and everything you could wish for. It was interesting to hear that only two people run it, and they have been there for quite a long time. One of the ladies took us behind the counter of the post-office and explained that she kept over 100 stamps. The shop is hidden along a country lane and often hitch-hikers and cyclists holidaying in England come in to ask the way. It is the only shop in the village and mainly elderly people without cars use it; the younger people go to Brighton or East Grinstead to the bigger shops.
